info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 23 at 7:26AM CDT until April 23 at 10:30AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Fayette.
* WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 725 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen, with an isolated pocket up to 5 inches just northeast of La Grange. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... La Grange, Schulenburg, Flatonia, Fayetteville, Round Top, Muldoon, Mullins Prairie, Ammannsville, Holman, Swiss Alp, Rutersville, Rabbs Prairie, Dubina, O'Quinn, Plum, Freyburg, Ellinger, High Hill, Walhalla and Warrenton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING
